bibl.title: Letter from Luis B. Pogolotti to Philip Showalter Hench, October 17, 1940

div1.p: Pogolotti assures Hench that he is positive the shack is Camp Lazear Building No. 1.

div1.head: Letter from Luis B. Pogolotti to Philip Showalter Hench, October 17, 1940
div1.opener:
Marianao Oct. 17 - 1940
Dr. Philip. S. Hench
Rochester.
Dear Dr. Hench,
div1.p:
I received the pictures you
sent me and I thank you
very much.

I also received yo the
copy of the letter to Mr. Moran
of the 12th last and as I
see that Mr. Moran will
leave soon for the States and
will give you personally all
the details of the “Historical Shack”
I omit particulars on the matter
which are not very easy for me
to explain in a letter.

I congratulate you for the
intelligent way you have
conducted the investigation, and
on my part I assure you, I have
received enough satisfaccion or reward to
see that my opinion on Mr.
Adrian Macia was not wrong

Hoping that the report I sent you through
Mrs. Phillips and to hear from you soon.
div1.closer:
I remain your friend Louis Pogolotti (over)
CL
P. S.
Just before closing and mail
this letter, I had a telephone
call from Mr. Moran asking
me if I had received your
last letter (in answer to his
special delivery letter) giving you
the surprise news of Mr. Adrian Macia
I suppose my brother will
give me the letter tomorrow morning.
I agree with Mr. Moran as to
the little house being the real
shack, in fact I am as sure as he
is and put in aritmetical form
I would say 100/100-sure-
I think that the sketch made by-
Dr. A. Agramonte was made “on
memory” datas I mean from an office
may be in Habana, without giving
the importance we give to that
now about 25 year after.
It isn't used in Cuba a ceiling
like that, Mr. A. Macia is an
arquitect and he said that too.
The distance from the other
house (shack) was measured by
Mr. Moran today and found about
what you think
L Pogolotti
